questiontext.text:
Example

Suppose that the position of a particle at time \(t\) is given by \(x(t)=4t^3 -2t\). What is the force on the object at time \(t=1\) if the mass of the particle is \(3\)kg

Solution

We have \(x(t)=4t^3 -2t\), so differentiating this gives us the velocity \(v(t) = 12t^2 -2\). Differentiating again gives us acceleration \(a(t) = 24t\). Now, using the second law of motion we have \[ F = m \frac{d^2x}{dt} = 3(24t) = 72t. \] thus when \(t=3\) the force is given by \(216N\).
